channel.title: New Gaming PC Setup
channel.description:
3x - GTX 460 GDDR5 1GB; £600 2x - Corsair Memory Corsair 6GB DDR3; £400 1x - ASUS P6T6 WS Revolution; £350 1x - Intel Core i7 920 2.66GHz; £200 1x - Western Digital 1TB; £100 1x - 1250W Coolermaster Real Power Pro; £200
Total - £1850
NOTE: All prices are estimates, prices could vary.
Any suggestions to change or add? The processor will be overclocked to about 3.6GHz and the graphics cards will also, all be overclocked and running in SLI.

item.title: New Gaming PC Setup
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

How about replacing the 3x 460s for 3x 480s. Or would it be a waste of money as tri sli on the 480 is beast, I don’t think I’d need that much graphical power, :o.

I’ll get 2 480s as the current processors don’t seem to be powerful enough to handle 3 480s.

Read full topic

item.title: New Gaming PC Setup
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

tri sli is not supported on the 460, remove one of them and get a 60gb SSD, far overkill psu and is it just me or are those prices real expensive.

Read full topic

item.title: New Gaming PC Setup
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Thanks for your suggestions although the SSDs are quite expensive, the cheapest I’ve been able to find was about £430 for a 240GB SATA II. Two of these would nearly double the price.

Read full topic

item.title: New Gaming PC Setup
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Id get a SSD for your games / OS and swap the 1TB for two 500GB and run them as RAID0 (Stripe) for faster read/write

other than that, looks good.

Read full topic

Any suggestions to change or add? The processor will be overclocked to about 3.6GHz and the graphics cards will also, all be overclocked and running in SLI.
